question.text: The correct statement about ptyalin and pancreatic amylase is:

options.text: Ptyalin breaks down only cooked starch in acidic medium while pancreatic amylase breaks down only uncooked starch in alkaline medium.
Ptyalin breaks down only cooked starch in alkaline medium while pancreatic amylase breaks down only uncooked starch in acidic medium.
Ptyalin breaks down only uncooked starch in acidic medium while pancreatic amylase breaks down only cooked starch in alkaline medium.
Ptyalin breaks down only cooked starch in acidic medium while pancreatic amylase breaks down cooked as well as uncooked starch in alkaline medium.

solution.text: Ptyalin, i.e., salivary amylase, produced by parotid glands breaks down only cooked starch at pH 6.8, whereas amylopsin, i.e.,  pancreatic amylase, breaks down cooked as well as uncooked starch at pH 7.8.
